author: dwdsquared2
body:
**Events in the US Today (EDT):**

* 7:00am - MBA Mortgage Apps. (WoW) & 30-yr Rate \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 8:30am - Goods Trade Balance (Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
   * Retail Inv. Ex Auto (Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 9:00am - The House meets for session
* 9:30am - Seevol Cushing Oil Storage Report \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 10:00am - Pending Home Sales (MoM-Jun) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * The Senate meets for session
* 10:30am - Crude Oil Inventories \[3/3 Volatility\]
* 12:00pm - House Committee Hearing: Examining the Dominance of Amazon, Apple, Facebook, and Google
   * [YouTube Live Link](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WBFDQvIrWYM&feature=emb_title)
   * [News article on why the hearing is happening & possible outcomes](https://thehill.com/policy/technology/509287-top-tech-ceos-brace-for-house-grilling)
   * Witnesses
      * Jeff Bezos, Amazon ([Prepared Statement](http://docs.house.gov/meetings/JU/JU05/20200729/110883/HHRG-116-JU05-Wstate-BezosJ-20200729.pdf))
      * Tim Cook, Apple ([Prepared Statement](http://docs.house.gov/meetings/JU/JU05/20200729/110883/HHRG-116-JU05-Wstate-CookT-20200729.pdf))
      * Sundar Pichai, Alphabet/Google ([Prepared Statement](http://docs.house.gov/meetings/JU/JU05/20200729/110883/HHRG-116-JU05-Wstate-PichaiS-20200729.pdf))
      * Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook ([Prepared Statement](http://docs.house.gov/meetings/JU/JU05/20200729/110883/HHRG-116-JU05-Wstate-ZuckerbergM-20200729.pdf))
* 1:35pm - POTUS participates in a roundtable with supporters
   * Odessa Marriott Hotel and Conference Center, Odessa, Texas
* **2:00pm - FOMC Statement \[3/3 Volatility\]**
   * **Fed Interest Rate Decision \[3/3 Volatility\]**
* 2:05pm - POTUS delivers remarks at a fundraising committee reception
* **2:30pm - FOMC Press Conference \[3/3 Volatility\]**
   * Conducted by Chairman Jerome Powell
* 3:50pm - POTUS participates in a tour of Double Eagle Energy Oil Rig
   * Double Eagle Energy Oil Rig, Permian Basin, Texas
* 4:20pm - POTUS delivers remarks on restoring energy dominance in the Permian Basin and signs Presidential Permits
* The Fed announced yesterday that it extended most of its emergency lending programs by three months, through the remainder of 2020
* Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell said he would not bring up a coronavirus aid bill in the Senate which does not include liability protections
   * Democratic leaders met again on Tuesday with top Trump administration negotiators
   * Trump partially dismissed the GOP’s plan during a press conference on Tuesday, calling the package “sort of semi-irrelevant” as the bill involved no Democratic input

**Events in the World Today (EDT):**

* 1:30am - Japan BoJ Deputy Gov Amamiya Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 4:00am - South Africa Core CPI (MoM-Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 8:00am - Brazil Unemployment Rate \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 6:45pm - New Zealand Building Consents (MoM-Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 7:50pm - Japan Retail Sales (YoY-Jun) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 9:00pm - New Zealand ANZ Business Confidence (Jul) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* Shares slid in Japan, where Fitch Ratings lowered its outlook on the country’s debt and earnings at Canon Inc. disappointed
* Vietnam Prime Minister Nguyen Xuan Phuc said every province and city in the country was at high risk of coronavirus infections
* Hong Kong faces large-scale outbreak that may lead to a ‘collapse’ of its hospital system, Carrie Lam says
* Oil prices have stabilized after the American Petroleum Institute’s weekly estimate of U.S. crude inventories showed a much bigger draw than expected

**Earnings Before Open:**

* General Dynamics, Shopify, Boeing (7:30am), GE (6:20am), Spotify (6:00am), Aphria, Anthem, Wingstop, GM (7:30am), Six Flags, Blue Apron (6:15am), ADP

**Earnings After Close:**

* PayPal (4:15pm), Qualcomm (4:00pm), Teladoc, ServiceNow, Lam Research, Crown castle, Qorvo (4:00pm), O'Reilly Auto Parts, United Rentals, Vale

[Earnings this Week](https://i.redd.it/6i19e9do82d51.jpg)

> Yeah but it’s the deaths you have to look at

3) Deaths tick up

> Yeah but ADP rev’d their jobs number up 6 million from a loss of nearly 3 million to a gain of 3 million

author: TAWS
body: RIP ADP

author: YuriTheRussianBot
body:
SQ was on a roll last few months, I'm glad I didn't sell, and now it's close to doubling my position. But I truly believe they'll keep growing. They're still minuscule when compared to even to PAYPAL, so I believe there's still plenty of growth left. Same with MC. So, if I was you, I'd buy them, especially if there's a pullback. 

I do own SQ, MC, and AMZN strictly because of the growth that is still ahead of them. There's also two growth stocks I'm truly impressed with - PAYC (I do own them) and PAYX - don't own, but tempted to jump on their ride. They're also in growth mode, still tiny compared to industry behemoths like ADP. Personally, I think MC is a good buy at this price, SQ is a bit overbought, AMZN too, but if you're buying to hold them for long period of time it don't matter.

author: VeryStableGenius
body:
So ADP fixed their May numbers to agree with the BLS numbers released after the first round of bad ADP numbers?  

And June recovery continues but not as strong as May?  But ADP's record is now looking bad, though they presumably fixed their methodology.

edit: it seems that the one reliable number should be from counting payroll tax payments. Why don't they do that?  Or it isn't so easy?  This can count full vs partial employment too.

author: CDS_2008
body:
I did some research into ADP. The good thing is that they have strong fundamentals as well as profitability:

Fundamentals:

Debt/Equity: 0.44 (Very attractive especially in this low rate environment)

Interest Coverage: 25 (Can easily pay interest payments)

Carlos Rodriguez has been CEO since 2011. In that time frame the company has been successful with growing Revenue and Earnings.

&#x200B;

Profits:

Operating Margin: 20% (Again another very high number)

ROE and ROA: 47% and 5% (ROE is high yet ROA is low which could be interpreted as the company is not effectively using it's base assets to generate a profit)

Growing Revenue and Growing Earnings

&#x200B;

Price:

P/E: 25 (Investors expect the company to keep doing what it's doing. If the company cannot keep up the pace then share price might fall as a result)

author: Objective_Stage
body:
My guess is a lot, a whole lot, of people were furloughed (so they're still technically on payroll) and a lot of employers didn't report that correctly or ADP misinterpreted it.

I mean, I'd have to go read their methods to know but i suspect it's something like that given how many were furloughed.

author: S79S79
MasterCookSwag
body: The issue is that the method of job losses - furloughs, service workers not being layed off but not given any hours due to closure, businesses closing but not formally firing staff, etc all fucks up the surveying and data collection.  Both the ADP and BLS releases have been coming with significant footnotes basically saying “data collection is extremely unreliable right now because a ton of people simply aren’t submitting data or are answering questions the wrong way”.

author: Potato_Octopi
body: You're counting tens of millions of workers and ADP has large gaps they need to model around. You can't just count a net change, you need to count the data set then figure the net change. Even where their data is good, they're still collecting data from thousands of businesses with millions of new entries / updated entries per month. And the first number comes out just days after the month ends.

author: Messiah1934
body:
I have a theory, considering this is ADP.


Just recently ADP added a feature in their time-off module labeled "ERC - Paid-Non-Work-Day". As someone that has been on 3 day work weeks since March, but being paid full salary, I assume this might have something to do with it. This feature was just added about 7 weeks ago, and 2 weeks ago we were all sent a reminder to go back and re-assure that all of our "scheduled furlough days" were set correctly in the ADP system. 


I guess it's possible that these were wrongly reported, and got re-adjusted as ADP asked employers to have their employees assure the furlough's were recorded correctly?

author: Qel_Hoth
body:
The ADP May report wasn't a prediction, it was an analysis of data collected in may, presented in early June.

This is more like saying "We surveyed beachgoers and our data indicates that there was a catastrophic hurricane." followed a few weeks later by "After further analysis, our data seems to indicate that there was, in fact, no hurricane at all and it was actually a perfect beach day."
